title: Firefox bookmarks-list window (ctrl-shift-O) behaviors
content:
1. topic Earlier i could edit my Firefox bookmarks in the bookmarks-list window and then i change my cursor to other place and Firefox (miraculously) saved that new modification of bookmark to bookmarks-list. Nowadays i can't do that. Actually, i can edit a bookmark but i can't save it? It doesn't happend so any more and there isn't any "save"-button? Now I don't know how i can save bookmark if i edit it?

Currently it seems to be only way to get new modification of bookmark if i browse to some web-address then save that address to bookmarks-list. After that you can remove the old, wrong web-address. But you can't get own headline text to your new bookmark?

2. topic This is long-time idea. I have lots of bookmarks and sub-folders in my bookmarks-list (library). When i add new bookmark to list and like to put it to some specific sub-folder i can use left side bookmark-tree to browse bookmark to correct place. When i want search e.g. all bookmarks which have string "Firefox", i can't see if they all are same specific sub-folder like i want to. I can see headline text and web-address but i can't see where that bookmark is in library. Could we get bookmark-tree-path somehow to search output? And, it would be nice if i could click directly to that sub-folder to see if there would be even better bookmark for my need? At this moment (and earlier also) keywords are the only way try check if bookmarks are correct folder. But almost always web-pages don't fill keywords. So you should do it yourself. The bookmark-tree-path would be much more useful info after use search to find some subject bookmarks.

creator: kiharamuchangi

title: Disable URL autocomplete for history suggestions
content:
I try to type a URL I visit a lot, like usbank, but typing `us` auto-populates us-west turbotax (a site I visit during tax month), I hit Enter after `us` thinking it put usbank in there, and end up going to turbotax... this is so annoying. Note that URL auto-complete is the feature I'm talking about:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/address-bar-autocomplete-firefox#w_url-autocomplete

I go to usbank several times per month. I visit turbotax several times per year. `us` isn't intuitive with turbotax, but it is intuitive with usbank. Firefox thinks I mean the less-visited URL for some reason. I have usbank bookmarked, I don't have the turbotax link bookmarked; why is Firefox auto-completing a less-used non-bookmarked URL over a more-used bookmarked URL?!

I know I can disable URL auto-complete by going to about:config and searching for browser.urlbar.autofill then setting it from true to false. However, this would also prevent usbank and other useful URLs I do mean to go to from auto-completing. How do we make Firefox smart, and use the more-often bookmarked URL over the less-used non-bookmarked URL? I'm pretty sure Chrome is smart about it; it seems to populate what I use more, and stops auto-populating non-bookmarked URLs that I haven't used in a while.
creator: davecast

creator: ddixon47

title: Ant Video Downloader eating up all available system memory
content:
This started two days ago. I did not recognize what was happening, but the computer slowed to a point of complete unresponsiveness. I had to hold the power button in for a hard shutdown. Next day, I was watching a YouTube video, the video stopped playing, and the computer slowed to a snail's pace. Task Manager revealed something was using up ALL system memory. A look at running processes showed that the culprit was Firefox.

Firefox would start normally, then gobble up all system memory over a few minutes, rendering the computer almost inoperable.

Tried garbage collection, CC, and minimize memory usage under about:memory. This would temporarily reduce overhead, but then it would climb back up next time I started Firefox.

The Ant Video Downloader underwent a redesign days ago; this memory issue started exactly two days ago, on Friday evening, the 7th of January, 2022.

I disabled the add-on. At this moment, Firefox memory use is 642,716 KB of an available 12 GB. There seems to be one main process using the largest share of memory (200-300,000 KB) with 12 other firefox.exe processes running concurrently, all using smaller amounts of system memory. Firefox memory use no longer climbs until all system memory is consumed.

Is there any way to rein in memory use by Firefox add-ons short of disabling them? Are other users reporting this issue? How are add-ons vetted prior to use with the browser? There are few of these video downloaders available. Most are merely copies of a single piece of non-functioning software—but listed under different names, supported by what are clearly fake reviews. Is anyone verifying the integrity of these add-ons in addition to their developers?

In this case, the developer is based in Hong Kong.

Thank you to the community for any assistance offered in this case.
creator: iamwileecoyote

title: Smyčka přesměrování
content: Dobrý den, po aktualizaci Mozilla mi při zadání hesla na stránkách píše smyčka přesměrování. Na další stránce se objeví pouze nepodařilo se přihlásit. V telefonu stránky fungují vpořádku. Co je změněného v zabazpečení po poslední aktualizaci? Co vypnout aby se stránky zobrazili? Již jsem zkoušel vymazání cookies, vypnutí rožšířené ochrany a stále se nedaří. Děkuji za radu.

title: ESPN.com website keeps redirecting to it's foreign sites
content:
Hello,

I have the site espn.com bookmarked and for the last month or so it has been opening it's various foreign sites instead of the united states version when I click on the bookmark tab. It will switch to the UK and Mexico sites randomly when I click on the tab. The address is saved as the US version (espn.com) when this happens so I can't figure out why it's doing it. It doesn't matter if I use a vpn that says I'm in the US or just my regular internet provider in the US, the site keeps changing what country it chooses to open with. I noticed that every time I click the tab it will cycle between the various different sites for each country even though as I said before, the bookmark is set for espn.com. It makes no sense as none of my other bookmarks do this and it doesn't do it when I use Safari's browser. Is there anything on my end I can do to get this to stop or is it coming from espn.com's end? Thank you for your time and help. :)
creator: mtnrydr

title: How to stop popup video boxes?
content:
When I search for autoplay in about:config I get quite a few matches and have disabled all of them (I think). Yet video boxes/windows still popup blocking part of the page. Is there any way of stopping them? At least now the sound has been muted. But when I checked permissions for a particularly aggravating website I see that in Permissions I see autoplay is allowed/default. It seems Firefox is intent on disrupting my reading by these incessant and pestering videos, 99% of which are utter drivel and have nothing to do with what I'm trying to read. Its like web design by 8 year old children.

What is the solution for killing video popups once and for all? As videos often don't even work in Firefox I've relegated video watching to Chrome which is fine. I use Firefox for reading and Chrome for watching. No problem.

title: Syncing using qr code on PC
content: I've lost the password to my Firefox account, which hasn't been a problem moving onto new mobile devices since I can just use the QR code generated by my PC browser to Sync. Is there a way around this or am I going to have to reset my password and lose all my encrypted data? Thanks for the help.
